intro: Hieracium decolor, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellowish to pale green, and the leaves are usually hairy and lobed. Hieracium decolor is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
